entry.title: Локалізація рішень SAP для українських компаній
entry.content:
Шановна спільното !

З 1998 року наша команда забезпечує локалізацію рішень SAP для українських компаній, адаптуючи їх до національних стандартів і законодавства. SAP в Україні — це не лише міжнародні IT-рішення, а й інвестиції в локальні адаптації, що враховують потреби українського ринку.  SAP в Україні — це не лише міжнародні IT-рішення, а й інвестиції в локальні адаптації, що враховують потреби українського ринку. Завдяки цьому компанії отримують ефективні інструменти як для внутрішнього ринку, так і для виходу на міжнародну арену.

Основні аспекти локалізації в SAP:

1. Мовні та культурні аспекти:

  • Переклад текстів: Локалізація користувацького інтерфейсу, звітів, а також AI-powered instant переклад документації та інших текстових документів за допомогою SAP Translation Hub
  • Культурна адаптація: Врахування культурних особливостей, таких як формати дат, чисел, валют, тощо

2. Правові та регуляторні вимоги:

  • Податкові закони: Враховування місцевих податкових правил та вимог до обліку та звітності.
  • Регуляторні стандарти: Забезпечення відповідності місцевим законодавчим та регуляторним вимогам.

3. Фінансові та бухгалтерські аспекти:

  • Бухгалтерський облік та звітність:: Адаптація під місцеві бухгалтерські стандарти та практики.
  • Валютні операції: Підтримка різних валют та обмінних курсів.

4. Адміністрування персоналу та облік заробітної плати:

  • Підтримка законодавства: адаптація до місцевих вимог

5. Логістика та постачання:

  • Логістичні процеси: Адаптація логістичних процесів до місцевих умов та інфраструктури.

6. Тестування та валідація:

  • Функціональне тестування: Перевірка функціональності системи в умовах локалізованого середовища.
  • Регресійне тестування: Перевірка того, що зміни внаслідок локалізації не вплинули негативно на існуючу функціональність.

7. Підтримка та обслуговування:

  • Підтримка законодавчих змін: адаптація локалізованої функціональності до змін в законодавстві
  • Міжнародна підтримка: Надання підтримки користувачам на місцевых мовах та врахування місцевих часових зон.
  • Оновлення та патчі: Вчасне оновлення системи для відповідності змінам в місцевому законодавстві та регуляторних вимогах.

Знайомтесь з нашими найкращими експертами та приєднуйтесь до української спільноти SAP з локалізації задля обміну потребами, знаннями та досвідом та участі в прийнятті найбільш ефективних рішень з розвитку локалізації.

Тетяна Віляєва – eкспертка з фінансових onPrem рішень SAP та українського законодавства. Системний підхід до найскладніших задач.

📍Група: SAP ERP (Фінанси та логістика)

Хочете поспілкуватися, поділитися досвідом або дізнатися більше про локалізацію? Її група чекає на вас SAP ERP (Фінанси та логістика)

Євгенія Гочева – eкспертка з усіх HCM рішень SAP. Знає кожну статтю HR-законодавства та знаходить компроміси у найскладніших ситуаціях.

📍Група: HCM (Управління персоналом та заробітна плата)

Поспілкуватися можна приєднавшись до її групи прямо зараз НСМ (Управління персоналом та заробітна плата)

Юрій Тарченко – eксперт з індустріальних рішень SAP, SAF-T та електронного підпису. Тісна співпраця з партнерами.
📍Група: SAP IS-U (Індустріальні рішення для комунальних послуг)

Якщо ви хочете зануритися в нюанси локалізації, обговорити технічні або регуляторні аспекти рішень, чи просто цікавитеся найкращими галузевими практиками, доєднуйтесь SAP IS-U (Індустріальні Рішення для комунальних послуг/Utilities)

Людмила Якименко – eкспертка з S/4HANA Public Cloud з широким управлінським досвідом. Знає всі нюанси хмарної локалізації.

📍Група: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud

Людмила готова ділитися з вами новими підходами та знаходити індивідуальні рішення для ваших потреб. Вона з задоволенням обговорить ваші бізнес-запити та поділиться знаннями в групі SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud

Єгор Федотов – експерт із SAP HCM onPrem. Наразі с лужить Україні в лавах Збройних Сил України і дає нам можливість продовжувати працювати в складні часи. Ми з нетерпінням чекаємо дня, коли Єгор повернеться до нас, і ви зможете особисто обговорити з ним найтонші аспекти SAP HCM.

Всі ми сьогодні  докладаємо максимум зусиль, щоб підтримувати український бізнес. Ми відкриті до діалогу та раді співпраці, тому не вагайтеся - звертайтеся!

Локалізація, доступ до хмарних сервісів та спеціальні програми для малих і середніх підприємств дозволяють компаніям масштабуватися, розвиватися навіть в умовах війни та знаходити нові можливості для експорту і цифрової трансформації. 

📣Залишайте свої коментарі та пропозиції, адже ми прагнемо вдосконалити наші рішення на основі вашого досвіду. Разом ми зробимо ваш бізнес ще більш ефективним та успішним на глобальному рівні.


Також ми маємо свою власну веб-сторінку, присвячену активності SAP у країні: SAP Ukraine!

entry.title: Re: sap wm storage type 999 difference posting
entry.content:
Hello @ab20468864 

Difference storage types are determined by difference indicators, that are customized in Logistics Execution -> Warehouse Management -> Activities -> Confirmation -> Difference Indicators:

A difference indicator needs to be provided when a transfer order is confirmed with a difference e.g. is short picked. Notice that standard configuration defines empty difference indicator. Thus, even if you don't provide any indicator during a short pick, the empty indicator is used and 999 difference storage type is determined.

Best regards

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: Re: Creating sales invoices without accounting impact for...
entry.content:
It is not possible.

What exactly is the business case for this, why do you don't want to post the invoice? If you only need to print the invoice I would suggest several alternatives:

  • Use Sales order instead of AR invoice, you can create a separate print layout with header "Invoice" instead of "Sales Order"
  • Use 100% header discount on AR Invoice (you will also need to create a separate layout for AR invoice that shows document amounts without the header discount)
  • Use a development to create a reversal of journal entry generated by adding AR invoice (this way it still gets posted, but is immediately reversed so the balance is zero)

entry.title: Re: CDS View I_GLACCOUNTHIERARCHY is empty in SAP S/4HANA...
entry.content:
Hi Domik,

I am in a test system and already have SAP_ALL and SAP_NEW?

Was this really a question? If yes, well there is small chance that even with SAP_ALL you don't have all authorizations in the system. First because SAP_ALL does not grant all kinds of permissions (such as Fiori catalogs are not included) but also because SAP_ALL includes all available authorizations at generation time. So it really depends when they were generated. Did you have a recent upgrade for instance?

Anyway, you don't need only the authorization object but also the right values. Better than telling you what I can find in the system I have access to, better to show how you can find yourself

tcode SUIM is very handy in this scenario. One option is to search for roles by authorization values.

Then you can enter the authorization objects and values which we can identity on the access control. 

Just run it and you can find yourself. For a more granular search you can use "Roles by Complex Selection Criteria" where it's possible to add filters for role names, role types, roles that a given user has or hasn't and many extra stuff. 

Trust me, once you know it, you cannot leave without it.

entry.title: Re: Cloud Integration - What You Need to Know About the Kafka Adapter
entry.content:
Hi @Florian_Kube 

lingering does not mean to wait 200ms after the last one. It means to wait up to this linger time to fill up a whole batch and not immediately send out individual records.

I have a few ideas what might cause this, but cannot be sure:

 * is "parallel processing" enabled on the splitter? If not, each split-routine would need to finish first, before the splitter continues with the next split part. And the lingering is part of this routine, so it has to wait for 200ms and the next split will not reach the adapter "in parallel".

 * assuming "parallel processing" is enabled, I assume the MPL would still show 200+ ms for all individual kafka steps, as all of these steps would wait for ~200ms. That does not necessarily mean that 2 steps needed 400 ms. Still, both steps had to wait for 200 ms "in parallel", which would be correct. You can cross-check the overall runtime to assess what is going on. I could be wrong about the MPL.

If you need additional support, please create a support ticket.

Best regards

Jens

entry.title: Get Ready for the Mandatory Shift to E-invoicing in Belgium – The Clock is Ticking
entry.content:
What are the practical details included in the Royal Decree?

Next to the confirmation of the effective date of the Belgian e-invoicing mandate as of January 1st 2026, this Decree contains the following important points:

  1. Within the scope of the Belgian e-invoicing mandate, the structured electronic invoices must adhere to the European semantic and syntactic standard (EN 16931). The Peppol network, using the BIS format, is the default electronic exchange mechanism. This implies that all taxable persons who are subject to the Belgian e-invoicing obligation need to possess the technical means to issue and receive Peppol BIS e-invoices via Peppol.
  2. The ‘opt-out’ from Peppol is still possible: structured electronic invoices may be issued in formats other than those complying with the European standard and transmitted through alternative digital means, provided that there is a mutual agreement between the parties and to the extent that the format complies with the European standard. Note, however, that the Royal Decree clarifies 2 elements related to the ‘opt-out’ that differ from the initial description:
    • Taxpayers can use formats different from those that comply with the European standard only if they are converted into one of the formats meeting the European standard before issuance.
    • Even though businesses choose to apply the ‘opt-out’ mechanism, they must still be technically capable of sending and receiving e-invoices via the Peppol network.
  3. For structured electronic invoices issued in accordance with the European semantic and syntactic standard, rounding will only be permitted on the total amount per VAT rate, and not per line of the structured electronic invoice.
  4. In addition to existing penalties for non-compliance with invoicing rules, a new non-proportional penalty is introduced for not having the technical means that enable the issuance and receipt of structured electronic invoices via the Peppol network. The penalties are structured as follows:
    • 1.500 EUR for a first violation
    • 3.000 EUR for a second violation
    • 5.000 EUR for subsequent violations

To give businesses some time to act, a second or subsequent penalty can only be imposed by the tax authorities at the earliest three months after the previous penalty.

 

How SAP Document and Reporting Compliance assists you throughout your e-invoicing journey

It has been evident for some time that in many countries or regions there is a clear trend to mandate e-invoicing.

As said in my previous blog, SAP Document and Reporting Compliance is designed to help businesses navigate the complexities of e-invoicing and enable seamless compliance across multiple jurisdictions. Our solution aims for a global approach related to e-invoicing mandates: it currently supports over 55 countries.

For the upcoming B2B e-invoicing mandate, companies can use SAP Document and Reporting Compliance to manage their end-to-end processes of issuing and receiving electronic invoices through the Peppol network, in a compliant manner, with a direct integration into your existing SAP landscape. Furthermore, SAP holds a Peppol certificate, meaning that SAP is a certified Access Point on Peppol.

In addition to meeting legal requirements, SAP Document and Reporting Compliance provides robust features for operating effectively and for increasing your invoicing process efficiently.

 

Conclusion: If you don’t want to be late, act now

With the publication of the Royal Decree, the Belgian authorities emphasize the importance of getting ready for the e-invoicing mandate by January 1st 2026.

With less than 6 months, it is now time to act. It is time to equip your company with the right solution and tools so that you are prepared for this e-invoicing obligation.

Join the WorkZone group for SAP Document and Reporting Compliance for Belgium and be part of the community of SAP’s customers who are preparing for this mandate.

 

___________________________

Regulations are changing fast. Are you ready?

Join SAP experts and industry leaders to explore innovations and best practices in digital reporting and e-invoicing. Secure your spot at the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Virtual Summit on September 25 and discover how you can simplify complex compliance processes and stay ahead of global mandates.

Register now for free

entry.title: Reusing SAP PI/PO B2B mapping content in Cloud Integration - Trading Partner Management
entry.content:
Introduction

Hello B2B Integration Community,
As more organizations shift from on-premise solutions to cloud-based platforms like SAP Integration Suite, a common challenge arises—how to preserve and reuse existing investments in B2B mapping content developed over years in SAP PI/PO. For companies heavily reliant on B2B integrations, this migration poses the critical question:

Can legacy SAP PI/PO mapping artifacts be leveraged in SAP Cloud Integration, particularly with Trading Partner Management (TPM)?

In this blog post, I’ll walk you through the solution provided by the B2B Integration Factory, which enables seamless reuse of PI/PO mappings. We will cover:

  • Key challenges in migrating B2B integration

  • The high-level architecture of the solution

  • Key implementation aspects

  • A configuration guide to help you get started

Key Challenges in Migrating B2B Mappings from SAP PI/PO to SAP Integration Suite

Before diving into the solution, it's important to understand the primary challenges during the transition:

  • EDI Schema incompatibility: The hierarchical and segment-based structure and the differences in element naming conventions of EDI UN-EDIFACT, ASC-X12 and TRADACOMS messages does not align with the XML-based processing model used in SAP Integration Suite.
    The B2B Integration Factory addresses these challenges by introducing a generic framework that translates PI/PO XML EDI messages into structured XML that conforms to the expectations of Cloud Integration and vice versa for all of the mentioned three type systems.

  • the overhead of building and maintaining a large number of custom integration flows, especially for B2B scenarios involving many trading partners
    The B2B Integration Factory provides a generic framework in where you do not have to build and maintain individual flows.

  • gap in utilizing native B2B capabilities. Without a smart transition, the migration results in underutilization of built-in B2B features such as B2B Monitoring, Trading Partner Management (TPM), EDI validation and Business Documentation.
    The B2B integration Factory's solution simplifies the onboarding of trading partners using a repeatable configuration model compatible with TPM

High-Level Architecture Overview

The B2B Integration Factory bridges the gap between legacy SAP PI/PO B2B mappings and SAP Integration Suite, while enabling reuse, scalability, and compatibility with cloud-native B2B features like TPM and B2B Monitoring. The reusable generic framework dynamically handles all processing and removes the need to build custom flows for each partner and each message type. The following diagram illustrates how the dots are connected.

 

The mapping artifacts are decoupled from the flow and the sequence in the respective operating mapping is maintained as activity parameters in the corresponding Trading Partner Agreement (TPA)/Business Transaction Activity (BTA). The generic flow which will be called via custom mapping from each and every BTA is always the same. This flow dynamically reads the configured sequence from the TPM, locates the relevant mapping artifacts, and executes the defined transformation steps accordingly - including the resolution of EDI schema incompatibilities.

Key Implementation Aspects

Locating the relevant mapping artifact without hardcoding them into the integration flow is a key part of explaining the dynamic runtime behavior. To begin with, it is important to examine the possible execution sequence of the mapping logic:

Compliance with naming conventions and exact private key usage is required by the sequence. The table below outlines the parameter names, where $LoopIndex is a numeric index that has to be replaced by the relevant looped iteration.

Parameter KeyTypeParameter Value
MessageMapping_PreProc_XSLT_$LoopIndexBooleanOnly necessary and to be maintained if true
MessageMapping_PreProc_JAR_$LoopIndexStringProcessDirect Address to call the Java mapping
MessageMapping_$LoopIndexStringName of the message mapping
MessageMapping_PostProc_XSLT_$LoopIndexBooleanOnly necessary and to be maintained if true
MessageMapping_PostProc_JAR_$LoopIndexStringProcessDirect Address to call the Java mapping

There are three types of mapping programs, each located differently:

  1. Message Mapping – Will be migrated via the Migration tool and deployed as an individual message mapping artifact together with the dependent Function Libraries:

  2. XSLT Mapping –  located in the Cloud Integration Partner Directory (b), where the PID is the unique TPM PID (a) without the prefix 'SAP_TPM_'

  3. Java Mapping Classes – currently not supported in the Cloud Integration Partner Directory. Therefore a separate flow will be called in where the jar is deployed. A groovy script calls then the relevant class.

A configuration guide to help you get started

To begin with, we have to update the B2B Integration Factory Packages to the latest version and in particular deploy the generic flow running in the background:

 

The Process_Direct Address has to be maintained in each TPA/BTA:

Further, it is important to highlight a key distinction between inbound and outbound transactions. For inbound transactions - that means EDI CPI XML data need to be converted to EDI PI XML data - the Namespace as well as the Namespace Prefix matters for the PI/PO message mapping. These can be maintained in the relevant BTA. Parameter Private values are SAP_B2B_MM_Namespace & SAP_B2B_MM_Namespace_Prefix:

For outbound transactions - that means EDI PI XML data need to be converted to EDI CPI XML data - there is no need to maintain any parameter for the EDI PI XML to EDI CPI XML conversion. The EDI schema incompatibility is handled out of the box in the background for UN-EDIFACT and ASC-X12 messages. The approach for TRADACOMS schema translation is slightly different due to the significant variations in the translations. Here the Cloud Integration Partner Directory again comes into picture:

Here the user has to create a PID = TRADACOMS  and the ID has to follow the TRADACOMS EDI Standard (Type Systems --> TRADACOMS --> Messages):

Now as an example for the above use case the information of which type system, which message type and which version will be determined in runtime and a lookup is done to the Cloud Integration Partner Directory where the respective XSLT will be found which does the EDI schema translation. Here is a snippet of the .xsl for ORDHDR_FILE_9. You can follow the exact same pattern for your specific message type. And very important, it is a one time activity only per message type:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<xsl:stylesheet version="2.0" xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform"
    exclude-result-prefixes="#all">
    
    <xsl:output method="xml" encoding="UTF-8" indent="yes"/>
    
    <!--<xsl:param name="SAP_B2B_MM_Namespace" select="'http://sap.com/xi/B2B/Examples/Tradacoms'"/>
    <xsl:param name="SAP_B2B_MM_Namespace_Prefix" select="'ns0'"/>
    <xsl:param name="SAP_EDI_Application_Reference" select="'ORDHDR'"/>
    <xsl:param name="SAP_EDI_Message_Version" select="'9'"/>-->
    
    <xsl:param name="SAP_B2B_MM_Namespace"/>
    <xsl:param name="SAP_B2B_MM_Namespace_Prefix"/>
    <xsl:param name="SAP_EDI_Application_Reference"/>
    <xsl:param name="SAP_EDI_Message_Version"/>
    
    <!-- Root template -->
    <xsl:template match="/">
        <xsl:variable name="vTag" select="concat($SAP_EDI_Application_Reference, 'TO', $SAP_EDI_Message_Version)"/>
        <xsl:choose>
            <xsl:when test="$SAP_B2B_MM_Namespace_Prefix = ''">
                <xsl:element name="{$vTag}">
                    <xsl:apply-templates select="Interchange"/>
                </xsl:element>
            </xsl:when>
            <xsl:otherwise>
                <xsl:element name="{$SAP_B2B_MM_Namespace_Prefix}:{$vTag}" namespace="{$SAP_B2B_MM_Namespace}">
                    <xsl:apply-templates select="Interchange"/>
                </xsl:element>
            </xsl:otherwise>
        </xsl:choose>       
    </xsl:template>
    
    <xsl:template match="Interchange">  
            <!-- S_STX -->
            <S_STX>
                <C_STDS>
                    <D_IDEN><xsl:value-of select="S_STX/C_STDS/D_STDS1"/></D_IDEN>
                    <D_VERS><xsl:value-of select="S_STX/C_STDS/D_STDS2"/></D_VERS>
                </C_STDS>
                <C_FROM>
                    <D_CODE><xsl:value-of select="S_STX/C_FROM/D_FROM1"/></D_CODE>
                    <D_NAME><xsl:value-of select="S_STX/C_FROM/D_FROM2"/></D_NAME>
                </C_FROM>
                <C_UNTO>
                    <D_CODE><xsl:value-of select="S_STX/C_UNTO/D_UNTO1"/></D_CODE>
                </C_UNTO>
                <C_TRDT>
                    <D_DATE><xsl:value-of select="S_STX/C_TRDT/D_TRDT1"/></D_DATE>
                    <D_TIME><xsl:value-of select="S_STX/C_TRDT/D_TRDT2"/></D_TIME>
                </C_TRDT>
                <D_SNRF><xsl:value-of select="S_STX/D_SNRF"/></D_SNRF>
                <D_RCRF><!-- placeholder --></D_RCRF>
                <D_APRF><xsl:value-of select="S_STX/D_APRF"/></D_APRF>
                <D_PRCD><!-- placeholder --></D_PRCD>
            </S_STX>
            
            <!-- ORDHDR segment -->
            <ORDHDR>
                <S_MHD>
                    <D_MSRF><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDHDR/S_MHD/D_MSRF"/></D_MSRF>
                    <C_TYPE>
                        <D_TYPE><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDHDR/S_MHD/C_TYPE/D_TYPE1"/></D_TYPE>
                        <D_VSNR><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDHDR/S_MHD/C_TYPE/D_TYPE2"/></D_VSNR>
                    </C_TYPE>
                </S_MHD>
                <S_TYP>
                    <D_TCDE><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDHDR/S_TYP/D_TCDE"/></D_TCDE>
                </S_TYP>
                <S_SDT>
                    <C_SIDN>
                        <D_SALC><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDHDR/S_SDT/C_SIDN/D_SIDN2"/></D_SALC>
                        <D_SIAC><!-- placeholder --></D_SIAC>
                    </C_SIDN>
                    <D_SNAM><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDHDR/S_SDT/C_SIDN/D_SIDN1"/></D_SNAM>
                </S_SDT>
                <S_CDT>
                    <C_CIDN>
                        <D_CAID><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDHDR/S_CDT/C_CIDN/D_CIDN1"/></D_CAID>
                    </C_CIDN>
                    <D_CNAM><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDHDR/S_CDT/D_CNAM"/></D_CNAM>
                </S_CDT>
                <S_FIL>
                    <D_FLGN><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDHDR/S_FIL/D_FLGN"/></D_FLGN>
                    <D_FLVN><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDHDR/S_FIL/D_FLVN"/></D_FLVN>
                    <D_FLDT><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDHDR/S_FIL/D_FLDT"/></D_FLDT>
                </S_FIL>
                <S_MTR>
                    <D_NOSG><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDHDR/S_MTR/D_NOSG"/></D_NOSG>
                </S_MTR>
            </ORDHDR>
            
            <!-- ORDERS segment -->
            <ORDERS>
                <S_MHD>
                    <D_MSRF><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDERS/S_MHD/D_MSRF"/></D_MSRF>
                    <C_TYPE>
                        <D_TYPE><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDERS/S_MHD/C_TYPE/D_TYPE1"/></D_TYPE>
                        <D_VSNR><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDERS/S_MHD/C_TYPE/D_TYPE2"/></D_VSNR>
                    </C_TYPE>
                </S_MHD>
                <S_CLO>
                    <C_CLOC>
                        <D_CALC><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDERS/S_CLO/C_CLOC/D_CLOC1"/></D_CALC>
                    </C_CLOC>
                    <D_CNAM><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDERS/S_CLO/D_CNAM"/></D_CNAM>
                    <C_CADD>
                        <D_CAL1><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDERS/S_CLO/C_CADD/D_CADD1"/></D_CAL1>
                        <D_CAL2><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDERS/S_CLO/C_CADD/D_CADD2"/></D_CAL2>
                        <D_CAL3><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDERS/S_CLO/C_CADD/D_CADD3"/></D_CAL3>
                        <D_CAL4><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDERS/S_CLO/C_CADD/D_CADD4"/></D_CAL4>
                        <D_CUPC><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDERS/S_CLO/C_CADD/D_CADD5"/></D_CUPC>
                    </C_CADD>
                </S_CLO>
                <S_ORD>
                    <C_ORNO>
                        <D_CONR><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDERS/S_ORD/C_ORNO/D_ORNO1"/></D_CONR>
                        <D_DOPC><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDERS/S_ORD/C_ORNO/D_ORNO3"/></D_DOPC>
                    </C_ORNO>
                    <D_CLAS><!-- placeholder --></D_CLAS>
                    <D_ORCD><!-- placeholder --></D_ORCD>
                </S_ORD>
                <S_DIN>
                    <D_EDAT><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDERS/S_DIN/D_EDAT"/></D_EDAT>
                </S_DIN>
                <xsl:for-each select="M_ORDERS/G_OLD/S_OLD">
                    <L_OLD>
                        <S_OLD>
                            <D_SEQA><xsl:value-of select="D_SEQA"/></D_SEQA>
                            <C_SPRO>
                                <D_EANC><xsl:value-of select="C_SPRO/D_SPRO1"/></D_EANC>
                            </C_SPRO>
                            <C_CPRO>
                                <D_CITC><xsl:value-of select="C_CPRO/D_CPRO2"/></D_CITC>
                            </C_CPRO>
                            <C_UNOR>
                                <D_CUTU><xsl:value-of select="C_UNOR/D_UNOR1"/></D_CUTU>
                            </C_UNOR>
                            <C_OQTY>
                                <D_NTUO><xsl:value-of select="C_OQTY/D_OQTY1"/></D_NTUO>
                            </C_OQTY>
                            <C_OUCT>
                                <D_CPRC><xsl:value-of select="C_OUCT/D_OUCT1"/></D_CPRC>
                            </C_OUCT>
                            <C_TDES>
                                <D_TUL1><xsl:value-of select="C_TDES/D_TDES1"/></D_TUL1>
                            </C_TDES>
                        </S_OLD>
                    </L_OLD>
                </xsl:for-each>
                <S_OTR><D_LORD><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDERS/S_OTR/D_LORD"/></D_LORD></S_OTR>
                <S_MTR><D_NOSG><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDERS/S_MTR/D_NOSG"/></D_NOSG></S_MTR>
            </ORDERS>
            
            <!-- ORDTLR segment -->
            <ORDTLR>
                <S_MHD>
                    <D_MSRF><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDTLR/S_MHD/D_MSRF"/></D_MSRF>
                    <C_TYPE>
                        <D_TYPE><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDTLR/S_MHD/C_TYPE/D_TYPE1"/></D_TYPE>
                        <D_VSNR><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDTLR/S_MHD/C_TYPE/D_TYPE2"/></D_VSNR>
                    </C_TYPE>
                </S_MHD>
                <S_OFT><D_FTOR><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDTLR/S_OFT/D_FTOR"/></D_FTOR></S_OFT>
                <S_MTR><D_NOSG><xsl:value-of select="M_ORDTLR/S_MTR/D_NOSG"/></D_NOSG></S_MTR>
            </ORDTLR>
            
            <!-- Trailer -->
            <S_END><D_NMST><xsl:value-of select="S_END/D_NMST"/></D_NMST></S_END>
        
    </xsl:template>
</xsl:stylesheet>


Now, let's deep dive into two practical scenarios - one UN-EDIFACT DELFOR inbound and the other UN-EDIFACT DESADV outbound. 

Inbound UN-EDIFACT Case

As we have seen so far the ultimate goal is to decouple the mapping artifacts and to control the automation via just setting Activity parameters in the TPA/BTA:

The first two parameters are already explained above. Now additionally by following the naming conventions we can also see the sequence in the Operating Mapping. In this case we first run a XSLT mapping and then the message mapping. The last parameter is to indicate that the Assembly process is not necessarily needed. 
And that is all we have to do. Now let us see how it looks in runtime, especially in B2B Monitor:

We can see that the PI/PO artifacts are linked to TPM and thus also to B2B Monitoring. Inside each interchange there are several events and for the transformation part the 'Sender Interchange Mapped' event is of interest. By clicking on the hyperlink you are re-directed to the MPL Log of the relevant Flow:

Here we also do log the artifacts in Custom Headers. Particularly to enhance user experience and to facilitate operational excellence. Since the XSLTs are stored in the Cloud Integration Partner Directory the Custom Header directly tell where exactly that particular .xsl is stored. 
Additionaly, important and only relevant for unit testing, we are also writing attachments to track each transformation step:

Outbound UN-EDIFACT Case

Again the approach is to deploy the mapping artifacts and then set the relevant Activity parameters:

Here, the last Message Mapping is just a 1:1 mapping from the output of Message Mapping 2. That should illustrate that we can have an endless sequence which will be supported in the framework. In B2B Monitor:

And there is more

The solution comes from the B2B Integration Factory initiative and was designed for the B2B Integration Factory packages. However, it was designed in such a way that the flow is fully compatible with the SAP standard TPM V2 packages:

Additional benefits

  • The solution leverages the B2B capabilities with their full functionalities, which allows users using the retry and restart functionality from B2B Monitor
  • Since the mapping artifacts are decoupled, fixes can be applied directly within the mapping itself—no flow deployment is required - and the message can be re-triggered using the B2B Monitor
  • Scaleable migration process - there is no need to build and maintain individual flows.
    This is also where the product vision is heading towards. Users should maintain their requirements with the trading partners in the TPM only. The number of flows should be reduced to a minimum.

entry.title: Duplicate MATMAS IDoc Generation via POIM and BD10 – How to Prevent It?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm currently facing an issue while sending IDocs to an external system. The IDoc types involved are: MATMAS, LOIBOM, LOIWCS, LOIROU, and CLFMAS.

To trigger the IDocs, I’m using the transactions POIM and BD10:

  • When I run POIM, it always generates a MATMAS IDoc along with the others. As far as I can tell, this behavior cannot be suppressed.
  • Afterwards, I use BD10 to send a CLFMAS IDoc for classification data. However, BD10 also automatically generates and sends a MATMAS IDoc, even though it was already sent via POIM.

This results in the material master being sent twice with each export. Once via POIM and again via BD10.

My question: Is there a way to prevent BD10 from generating the MATMAS IDoc when it has already been sent via POIM?
Alternatively, is there another method to send CLFMAS without triggering another MATMAS?

Any insights or experiences would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Re: How to upload documents in bulk using a background jo...
entry.content:
Hi Ewa,
as I understand your question, it is not directly related to SAP Document Extraction (new name SAP Document AI). You call it DIE but I think the official short name is DOX, so to search for solutions try to also search for DOX and SAP Document AI.

Anyway, as I said, I don't see your question as directly related to DOX. It is more about how to handle manu documents without having to upload them one by one from a PC.

The solution will depend on how you build your solution and also very much what environment your solution is running in.

  • Shall your solution run in SAP ERP, SAP S4/Hana, SAP ABAP Cloud, ....
  • Is the solution build in ABAP, SAP Build ...., JavaScript or ...

DOX will not handle the upload of multiple documents so that part you must build in combination of one of the above mentioned combinations of environments and development tool (programming languages). 

I'm an ABAP developer, so if I should build a solution like this I would build it in ABAP, so I will give an example of how to handle this in ABAP.

  • First make sure that the documents are stored in a location where it is available for the ABAP program running in background job. That would for example be in a folder on the SAP server, in SAP Content Server or directly in the SAP database. There are various methods to store the documents in one of these places. 
  • Then your program can read the documents one-by-one and extract the relevant data from the documents by passing them one by one to DOX. This would be done by calling the DOX APIs. 

This example was for ABAP, but I guess you probably can build your solution with any tool or programming language that is able to call the web API methods(endpoints) via http(s) URLs.
I' almost sure that no matter what tool you use for the solution the handling of multiple documents must be handled by the solution/application that you build. This part of the solution can not be handled by DOX APIs.

See the documentation for SAP Document AI (DOX) here: ab18043fd70e424dbcbcfd81585ff029.pdf the API documentation starts on page 131.


Best regards 

Thomas Madsen Nielsen

entry.title: Re: Duplicate MATMAS IDoc Generation via POIM and BD10 –...
entry.content:
Hello @RW1 

I don't think there is a way to stop BD10 from generating MATMAS IDocs when materials are already distributed with POIM. Those two transaction don't communicate with each other. BD10 simply doesn't know about MATMASes sent by POIM.

What you can do is:

  • either don't send MATMAS with POIM and use "send material in full" feature of BD10, which makes BD10 send classification data / CLFMAS too. See the note 2594233 - Transaction BD10 for MATMAS or ARTMAS automatically triggers all IDoc types
  • or keep sending MATMAS with POIM and use BD93 to send classification data / CLFMAS only.

Best regards

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: Destination Error in UI Integration Card while accessing from SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition
entry.content:
Hi All,

Writing this blog after solving my issue which I got unexpected.

Requirement:

I developed one UI Integration Card in SAP Business Application Studio (BAS) and I was able to the Preview of the card in the BAS which is getting data based on Stanadard Odata services from S/4HANA.

After that I Packaged the UI Integration Card in Content Package and imported in the SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition and I was able to access the card in my site. 

 

Error Details:

But suddenly effective from 25th July 2025, I got the below Error (PFA the error for same):

Destination "ecqrtcard" could not be resolved.

No technical destination found. Content Channel ID: "ovps". Please contact your administrator.

suddenly starting from 25th July 2025, I was getting above error. It might be becuase of SAP did some update in Standard Destination Configuraiton in BTP because earlier to 25ht July my card was working without error.

I raised the quesiton in the community but no one replied there, below is the link for my question where I only answered to my question:

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/ui-integration-card-error-while-accessing-in-sap-build-work-zone-standard/qaq-p/14162532#M4921009

 

Solution:

After reading lot of blog I was not able to find the solution then raised with SAP Support. They replied back with the following document:

https://help.sap.com/docs/build-work-zone-standard-edition/sap-build-work-zone-standard-edition/map-card-aliases-to-destinations

So here is the solution of the issue. We need to configure the Alias in the Content Package coniguration also in the Work Zone, PFA the below  Screen shot of the configuration:

1 - Map Aliases Configuration in Content Package for UI Integration Card.jpg

3 - Map Aliases Configuration in Content Package for UI Integration Card.jpg

4 - Map Aliases Configuration in Content Package for UI Integration Card.jpg

5 - Map Aliases Configuration in Content Package for UI Integration Card.jpg

After this configuraiton we need to refresh the site it will work (PFA the Screen shot "UI Card Access in BWZ, Standard Edition".

 

Hope this will help community to fix the issue.

 

Summary:

We need to get the alert from SAP if they are doing any patch update in the btp service and same reply I got over the Incident from SAP Team. After every patch we need to do end to end testing of our application to avoid any issue.

 

Conclusion:

So the final conclusion is that We need to map the aliases in each and every content package which we are creating in the Build Work Zone and need to test the application if we get any alert from SAP Team for patch update in SAP BTP Services.

 

Thanks.

Regards,

Rohit Gera

entry.title: Re: Not able to see "Deactivate line" and "Delate last ra...
entry.content:
The most common reasons could be

  • These buttons were introduced with SAP S/4HANA Cloud CE2105 for TDT countries (e.g., Turkey, Dominican Republic, etc.). If your system is on an earlier release or not scoped for those countries, the buttons won’t appear.
  • The buttons only show for tax codes with one condition and one period. If your tax code has multiple conditions or periods, SAP disables the deactivation option.

Check SAP Note 3056410 which explains the behavior and limitations of SSCUI 101016 and how to enable deactivation features

@govardhan_vegi98 

I had tried this and there is a SAC limitation that creates a challenge. In Pareto analysis you need a running total of contribution %  sorted by contribution. SAC running total calculation does not follow sort order.

https://launchpad.support.sap.com/#/notes/0003294430

The Table client calculation gives the correct results but unfortunately you cannot refer to client calculation in any charts or measures so getting the pareto chart or table becomes an issue.

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: Condition contract management delta accrual Foreign c...
entry.content:
I presume, it could be due to the following, if the said SAP note not addressed your issue

  1. The GR-based accruals might be posted in both document and local currency → reversed correctly using original FX rate.
  2. The Delta accruals might be posted in document currency, but during reversal, SAP treats them as local currency and converts them again using settlement M rate, not the original one.

Check the following:-

  • Ensure your delta accrual condition type (e.g. RED2) has proper subtotal settings and manual flag in the pricing procedure. Confirm that REA1 → REA2 and RED1 → RED2 mappings are correctly defined in Accrual Groups.
  • Check if the delta condition type is set to statistical or manual—this affects how currencies are handled. Review if the currency conversion logic is being overridden or skipped for delta lines.

entry.title: Re: A question on SAP Marketing Cloud Coupons (and Offers)
entry.content:
Hi, 

you can use API API_MKT_COUPON_SRV to achieve that. The relationship between the coupon, cod e and contact key is stored in a database table which can be queried via the entity CouponCod eUsage from the API mentioned above. This could look like this: 

https://{{yourhost}}:{{yourPort}}/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_MKT_COUPON_SRV/CouponCod eUsages?$filter=Coupon UUID eq guid'{{yourCoupon UUID}}'&$format=json&$top=100  . 

For more information please refer to the API hub: https://api.sap.com/api/API_MKT_COUPON_SRV/resource/Marketing_Coupon_Cod e_Usage

Unfortunately this returns only the keys of the coupon cod e and contact. You will need further calls to retrieve the contact ids (or names) and the textual coupon cod e from the keys. 

Hope that helps!

Best Regards

-Klaus

entry.title: Re: component consumption in a multilevel BOM in an order
entry.content:
To calculate the actual quantity of raw material N1 consumed in the production of finished material F1, based on daily production confirmations, not BOM structure, some key points you need to take into consideration and they are:

  1. Identify all sub-assemblies of F1 that include N1.
  2. Exclude N1 consumption from other finished materials.
  3. Use actual consumption data by pulling from production order confirmations (e.g. via CO11N). Include goods issue movements like 261 from MB51
  4. Consider tables like AFKO, AFVC, AUFM, RESB, MSEG, MKPF
  5. Focus on 261 (GI for order) and 101 (GR for order)
  6. Linkage logic can be check AUFNR to tie confirmations and goods issues to F1. Traverse BOM using STPO, STKO to map N1 under F1

Key SAP Tables for BOM Traversal are

entry.title: Re: How to build a responsive UI for a RAP business object that starts an asynchronous process
entry.content:
@AbhishekSharma sorry for my late reply.

It is not clear for me what you mean by "manually raised". 

The event is raised when a certain field of the RAP BO is updated. 
So the scenario here is that after saving the BO the asynchronous process is started. At the end of this process exactly that field of the calling instance of the RAP BO is being updated. As a result the event is raised and the UI is updated.

It would also work if some kind of application job would update lots of entities. Then the user that is looking at the data using a Fiori app would be able to see how the data is updated in his or her UI.

Hope this clarifies your request.

Kind regards,

Andre

entry.title: Re: Consume SAP BTP Document Information Extraction service for custom documents in ABAP
entry.content:
Hi @tejasjani 
My 90 days BTP trial account ended, so I started a new trial. 
In the new trial the SAP Document Extraction Tool is renamed to SAP Document AI and probaly there has also been other functional changes. 

Anyway, my ABAP program, that didn't receive back the data, now works 100% and I receive the data back after 10-20 seconds of polling.

There was one thing I had to do that I don't think you mention in the blog. I had to implement a certificate in transaction STRUST to make the connection to the DOX APIs work.
I guess there are different ways to setup the connections, but this is what workes in my setup:

  • I use SM59 and cl_http_client=>create_by_destination for the authentication.
  • For the DOX endpoints I use cl_http_client=>create_by_url and I could only make this work after installing the certificate. 
  • I run the ABAP part in a good old SAP ERP system with SAP_BASIS release 750.

Thanks again for your blog.
I have experimented with the DOX before, but only integrated in SAP Build Process automation. I am an ABAP developer, so naturally I find this option to call the DOX APIs from ABAP program much more usefull.

Regards 

Thomas.
